did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: Chiefly personal letters to her friend Marguerite Griswold, 1906- 1948, and to her daughter, Phoebe Stevens Mera, 1951-1954. Additional correspondence is with various associates of T.W. Stevens, and concerns her projected book on the history of the Globe Theatre. Typescript notes for that project are also present.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: Helen B. Stevens papers(MS 003). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Helen Bradshaw Stevens was a lecturer on the Southwest, etcher, and designer. She was also the wife of theatrician Thomas Wood Stevens, whose papers are at MS 002.

arrangement.head: Organization
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into two series

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Chiefly personal letters to her friend Marguerite Griswold, 1906- 1948, and to her daughter, Phoebe Stevens Mera, 1951-1954. Additional correspondence is with various associates of T.W. Stevens, and concerns her projected book on the history of the Globe Theatre. Typescript notes for that project are also present.

did.unittitle: H.S. to Daughter Phoebe (Mrs. F. Mera), 1951-1954
History of the Globe, T.W. Memorial Collections, and Scholarship, 1942-1944
Drafts, Notes, etc. from the Stevens book on the Globe Theatre 1933-1936
